body:
/kind bug

**What happened**:

To enforce daemonset pods scheduling is handled by default scheduler, instead of ds controller, I enabled `ScheduleDaemonSetPods` feature, and it looks almost fine except for a flaw: for a cluster spawned by kubeadm, the daemonset pod is still scheduled to master node with "pending" state.

```
$ k get node
NAME                           STATUS    ROLES     AGE       VERSION
wei-k8s-master.fyre.ibm.com    Ready     master    8d        v1.11.0
wei-k8s-worker1.fyre.ibm.com   Ready     <none>    8d        v1.11.0
wei-k8s-worker2.fyre.ibm.com   Ready     <none>    8d        v1.11.0
$ k get ds
NAME      DESIRED   CURRENT   READY     UP-TO-DATE   AVAILABLE   NODE SELECTOR   AGE
busybox   3         3         2         3            2           <none>          16m
$ k get pod -o wide
NAME            READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE       IP             NODE
busybox-f8m45   1/1       Running   0          16m       192.168.2.20   wei-k8s-worker2.fyre.ibm.com
busybox-fkzq5   1/1       Running   0          16m       192.168.1.24   wei-k8s-worker1.fyre.ibm.com
busybox-zb8g9   0/1       Pending   0          16m       <none>         <none>
```

**What you expected to happen**:

The behavior should be consistent as before (ds handled by ds controller). That's to say, on a kubeadm cluster, there shouldn't be a "Pending" pod scheduled onto master node.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

Spin up a kubeadm cluster, and deploy a sample daemonset yaml like this:

```yaml
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  name: busybox
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: busybox
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: busybox
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: busybox
        image: busybox
        command:
        - sleep
        - "3600"
```

**Anything else we need to know?**:

In a kubeadm cluster, master node has following spec:

```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Node
metadata:
......
  labels:
    beta.kubernetes.io/arch: amd64
    beta.kubernetes.io/os: linux
    kubernetes.io/hostname: wei-k8s-master.fyre.ibm.com
    node-role.kubernetes.io/master: ""
    opt: in
  name: wei-k8s-master.fyre.ibm.com
spec:
  podCIDR: 192.168.0.0/24
  taints:
  - effect: NoSchedule
    key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
......
```

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11", GitVersion:"v1.11.0", GitCommit:"91e7b4fd31fcd3d5f436da26c980becec37ceefe", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-06-27T20:17:28Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11", GitVersion:"v1.11.0", GitCommit:"91e7b4fd31fcd3d5f436da26c980becec37ceefe", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-06-27T20:08:34Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: vm
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 16.04
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
```
Linux wei-k8s-master.fyre.ibm.com 4.4.0-116-generic #140-Ubuntu SMP Mon Feb 12 21:23:04 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
- Install tools: kubeadm
- Others: none
